Violation_Type: Failure to properly assess Internal Flight Alternative
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining a viable Internal Flight Alternative in Budapest
Application_Facts: Applicants are Roma facing persecution in Hungary
Male applicant experienced attacks in Budapest
Defendant_Behavior: Board assumed better protection without evidence
Legal_Standard: Internal Flight Alternative test on balance of probabilities
Assessment_Factor: Reasonableness of seeking refuge in IFA
Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged, but documentary evidence relied upon
Evidence_Used: Documentary evidence on police protection and attacks in Budapest
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution in Hungary, lack of effective state protection
Evidence_Assessed: Documentary evidence on conditions for Roma in Budapest
Relief_Sought: Quashing of Board’s decision, remand for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: IFA requires no serious possibility of persecution and reasonableness of relocation
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board assumed improved protection without supporting evidence
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution due to Roma identity
Cause_Description: Applicants faced persecution in Hungary due to Roma ethnicity and sought protection in Canada
Evidence_Handling: Board failed to properly assess documentary evidence on safety in Budapest
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA principles on refugee protection and IFA assessment
Evidence_Issues: Lack of evidence to support assumption of safer conditions in Budapest
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over IRB decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evaluation of effectiveness of state protection in Budapest
Decision_Rationale: Board’s IFA conclusion not supported by evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Unsubstantiated assumptions about safety and protection in Budapest
Legal_Standard_Applied: Balance of probabilities, reasonableness of IFA
